title: Noooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo!

embed.description: Welcome to Ask Riot! Let's talk Azir, old-patch game modes, and skins becoming champs. We looked at doing this recently for a series of internal playtests, because we wanted to experience first-hand whether things like pacing or counterplay felt very different a few years ago.

body:
http://cdn.smosh.com/sites/default/files/legacy.images/smosh-pit/092010/starwars-11.jpg

The dreaded day has arrived, my beloved....
As much as I wished it would not.

You were unique, and this cruel world hated you for it!
I feel your skillcap dropping and your popularity rising, as the huddled masses eagerly grasp with greedy appendages at that which was once out of their reach! The thought brings sadness to my soul, and I pray it shall not be the case.

'counterplay' they call it, as if justified!
For how can one condemn your existence, while demons such as Draven, Darius, Lee, and The Unforgiven roam free!

You have lost much my friend, passives, knockups, tower-taking, and now they continue to take!

Be warned Wav3Break! greatness comes not from uniformity and compliance, the disease that has taken so many champions already. But rather from those who are difficult, different, and stand out on the edge where others fear to tread.
I pray this is not lost on you, Azir's fate is in your hands now, do not fail him as others have failed their updated champions!

Whatever happens, you shall not be forgotten Azir!
I shall fight on, in whatever form you take, with the true emperor always in my heart!

_**In brightest day, in blackest night.
The empire shall be reclaimed, as is your right!
Let all those who would aid in evil's plight.
Bow their heads -- under Shurima's might!**_

{{champion:268}}

I feel that a good balance to azir would be to have azir work on an energy like system 'Sand' rather than mana. As stupid as this sounds this would actually keep azir's difficulty and shift him more towards battle-mage and short term control dps, rather than oppressive zone control and lategame teamfight control dps.

Imo Azir's problem is when put in the hands of pros, his dps and range make him really oppressive, and his lategame ranged dps and his ability to split a fight and then spear enemies with soliders makes him problematic to balance.

Giving Azir 'Sand' could also make his combo's more risk-reward and make him have to toss up how he's going to position his soliders and allow you to give him back some of power and flexibility back. Having an energy type resource would mean that when and how he positions his soldiers becomes even more important, whilst also making him strong in lane.

Then again I'm a silver (I feel bronze) player so I'm probably completely wrong in how to approach a minor rework.

Honestly, in theory that sounds like a really good idea. I imagine Riot's concern with something like that is that there would still be far too large a gap between the average Azirs and the god tier ones. After all, if a champion is completely ineffective to begin with, why would you bother to continue learning him? For a huge number of people the answer would be just don't.

So I think the idea is to make him more accessible as well as more healthy which unfortunately means making him easier. Hopefully though, he will hit the mark of "easy to learn, really hard to master but you'll be super dope when you do" that some other more difficult champs like Ori and Xayah have hit. Really I think that's the ballpark they should be aiming for with most champions.
